headline: Aerospace firms scour contracts over tariffs after supplier challenge
summary: Planemakers, airlines and suppliers are combing through billions of dollars worth of contracts to check their exposure to tariffs after a major U.S. supplier sparked debate over who should pay for an emerging trade war, industry sources said on Monday.  Reuters reported on Friday that U.S. supplier Howmet Aerospace had declared a "force majeure event," effectively claiming the right to halt shipments if they were affected by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Howmet makes engine parts, fuselage fasteners and other components.

headline: High-Flying Defense Stocks Sink as Tariffs Upend Supply Chains

headline: Trump’s tariff defense under WTO rules could face legal challenges
summary: Investing.com -- The Trump administration’s decision to impose tariffs on civil aircraft parts may face legal challenges under international trade rules, according to Bank of America (BofA) analysts.
